definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: Mr. Alvarez has not yet been called to testify.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔瓦雷斯尚未被法庭传唤作证。

sentences.english: The witnesses were subpoenaed to attend the trial.
sentences.chinese: 用传票传唤证人参加审判。

sentences.english: Recently, I was called to the Religious Affairs Bureau and the United Front Work Department.
sentences.chinese: 最近我被国家宗教事务局和统一战线工作部传唤。

sentences.english: The defendant was given a copy fo information before he was called upon to plead.
sentences.chinese: 被告在被传唤进行辩护之前收到一份警方起诉书副本。

sentences.english: He was summoned as a witness.
The school district cited more than 400 parents this school year.
sentences.chinese: 在这个学年里，学区传唤了400多名学生家长。

sentences.english: Eventually, I was let out of the car and cited for disorderly conduct.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我被拉出车，并被以“行为不捡”被传唤。

sentences.english: The district judge summoned Yinling to appear in the court.
sentences.chinese: 地方政府法官传唤婴宁出庭。

sentences.english: Mr Mubarak's sons Gamal and Alaa have been summoned for questioning as well.
sentences.chinese: 穆巴拉克的儿子盖莫尔和阿拉也受到了传唤。

sentences.english: Then the prosecutor begins the most critical part of the trial.
sentences.chinese: 公诉人然后开始庭审的最关键部分，即传唤证人。

sentences.english: He was summonsed to appear in court.
All Necromancer pets now play a spawn animation when they are summoned.
sentences.chinese: 现在所有的死灵宠物发挥产卵动画当他们被传唤。

sentences.english: The summoned should report to the court with his summons.
sentences.chinese: 本票由被传唤人携带来院报到。
他被传唤，并罚款五十元。

sentences.english: Thats why Im standing here to summon people do it.
sentences.chinese: 因此，多数民众赞成林站在这里传唤人这样做。

sentences.english: Those wreckers whose identities are difficult to be checked and verified may be summoned according to law.
sentences.chinese: 对当场难以查实身份的肇事人，可以依法传唤。

definition: to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
in custody/to keep sb in detention
to make an appearance in court
to transfer (a case, a person, files etc)
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
